TEXT.English: [H1]Murad Bey[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD] Egyptian Mamluk Chieftain [\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] c.1750 - 1801 [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Murad Bey was an Egyptian Mamluk chieftain (Bey), cavalry commander and joint ruler of Egypt with Ibrahim Bey. He was of Georgian descent. Following his defeat at the hands of Napoleon's armies at the Battle of the Pyramids, Murad fled to Upper Egypt, mounting a brief guerrilla campaign that staved off Desaix for a year. In 1800, Murad made peace with Jean Baptiste Kléber, and agreed to garrison Cairo, but died of bubonic plague on his journey there.

TEXT.English: I am [OUR_NAME]; ride by my side or be cut down.
TEXT.French: Je suis [OUR_NAME]; soyez à mes côtés ou soyez décapité.
